oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Southern Railroad Company three dollar note
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This 3-dollar note was authorized by the legislature, and redeemable at the Southern Railroad Company's office in "current bank and Confederate Notes," and "Receivable in payment of Freight and Passage by all the Railroads in the State, and for all debts due the Souther Railroad Company." The reverse side appears to be a 5 note for a different railroad "& Deer" which has an image of George Washington.
